ARABIC: فَلَمَّا كَشَفْنَا عَنْهُمُ ٱلرِّجْزَ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ هُم بَٰلِغُوهُ إِذَا هُمْ يَنكُثُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But when We removed the plague from them - for a fixed term which they fulfilled - they broke their word.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But no sooner was the punishment withdrawn for a time to enable them to make good their promise than they broke it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: But when We removed the scourge from them until a term - a term which they were bound to reach - they at once broke their promise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: But when We relieved them from the torment for a given time, they again broke their promise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Consequently whenever We lifted the punishment from them for a term which they must reach, they used to then turn away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But when We removed the punishment from them for a fixed term, which they had to reach, behold! They broke their word!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But when We removed the plague from them till a term which they should attain lo! they broke (the promise).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: But when We removed from them the wrath unto a term that they should come to, lo, they broke their troth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But when We did remove from them the terror for a term which they must reach, behold! they broke their covenant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: but whenever We removed the plague from them, giving them time to make good their promise, they would break their word.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then whensoever We removed the plague from them, till a term which they were to reach, lo! they were breaking faith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But when We had removed the plague from them until a term that they should have completed, behold, they broke their promise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But every time We removed the penalty from them according to a fixed term which they had to fulfil,- Behold! they broke their word!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But when We removed the punishment from them to a fixed term, which they had to reach, behold! They broke their word!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But when We had lifted the plague from them for a term which they had to reach, they broke their promise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But when We lifted the plague from them, for a term they were to fulfill, they broke their promise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But when We removed the punishment from them until a term which they were to reach, then at once they broke their word.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [7:135] But when We removed, through the supplication of Moses, the terror from them to a term which they should reach, lo! they were already reneging, breaking their covenant and persisting in their disbelief.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But when We did remove from them the terror) the punishment (for a term which they must reach) i.e. the drowning, (behold! they broke their covenant) they broke their pledge to Moses.
